tweets.text: I realise that Twitter is not representative but is anyone satisfied with @EnvAgency performance in any of the areas they cover? I only see complaints (rivers, waste, flooding) and yet they have no oversight or real accountability.

A major milestone is reached in a £4.8m Middlesbrough flood scheme as a new debris screen is installed. 

The Marton West Beck flood scheme will better protect nearly 500 homes in the town, and also includes new flood walls and drainage system.

Read more: https://t.co/BmpfFTCMRr https://t.co/GcAWc4MFkn
@PaulReevesEA @EnvAgencyMids  Wyver Lane tributery into Derwent 16:22    Farm effluent? https://t.co/vjuEa9w4kx

urls.title: Van Oord nabs Lincolnshire coastal protection contract - Dredging Today
urls.description: Van Oord has inked a new contract with the Environment Agency to continue to protect the Lincolnshire coast of the UK for the next 4 years. The contract encompasses beach nourishment over the length of 20 kilometers and requires around 400,000 cubic meters of sand each year and continues the works Van Oord has been […]

tweets.text: Nearly 2.5 million tonnes of sand (1.6 million m3) over four years are needed to protect the Lincolnshire coastline  https://t.co/OIysxZHTBF

Today I’m amplifying the voices of our fantastic female @EnvAgency operational leaders. They lead our response on the ground across the country at a local level working on our flood & regulation work. 

#ActOnTheGap #TogetherForOurPlanet #ChooseToChallenge https://t.co/P4qXVvCryB

The @EnvAgency leadership team has a total of nine women. Today I’m celebrating our female Board members & executive directors, for all the work they do across the country to create better places for people and wildlife. #ActOnTheGap #TogetherForOurPlanet #ChooseToChallenge https://t.co/TjORbh0E2z

Our latest addition @LincsFireRescue Fleet, this magnificent multi-use appliance incorporating water carrier, environmental & chemical hazard equipment. Excellent partnership with @EnvAgency @Cawrey in support. https://t.co/SeI56uMKih

urls.title: Northumberland river sets new course after bank breach
urls.description: The River Coquet in Northumberland has taken a new course after overtopping its banks during heavy rain last month.

tweets.text:
We've carried out fish rescues on the River Coquet near Rothbury after a bank breach during heavy rain last month. 

The river has now set a new course and we've moved more than 250 fish from the depleted channel into the new stretch. 

Read more here: https://t.co/rRIKK2nYgt https://t.co/lgxcdCfa0e

@saveferriby2020

urls.title: Nurturing the next generation of women in science
urls.description: Today is International day of Women and Girls in Science. Unfortunately, we still need a special international day for this. Despite targeted efforts made over the past two decades to close the gap, women are still underrepresented in STEM (science, technology, engineering and maths). Those that have made it in are facing a stark gender pay gap, which in the UK is 50% greater than the national average for all employers. As well as this, 90% of funding for physical sciences and engineering goes to

tweets.text: @EmmaHowardBoyd @COP26 @EnvAgency @AdaptOurWorld We have a group of amazing female scientists on our team at @Earthwatch_Eur. Our head of science @TNoordwijk wrote a great blog about how we can nurture #WomenInSTEM. Perhaps you could give our voices a boost? https://t.co/1VhTymSnDa.
